metadata.title: Agent builds Flappy Bird clone in 47 seconds
metadata.description: Watch an OpenClaw agent create a fully playable Flappy Bird clone from scratch

content.text: User wants me to build a Flappy Bird clone. I'll use HTML5 Canvas for the game logic and simple CSS for styling. This should take about a minute if I focus on core mechanics first.

content.preview:
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
<head>
  <title>Flappy Bird</title>
  <link rel="stylesheet" href="style.css">
</head>
<body>
  <canvas id="game" width="400" height="600"></canvas>
  <script src="game.js"></script>
</body>
</html>

content.text: Now I need to implement the game loop, bird physics, and pipe generation. I'll use requestAnimationFrame for smooth 60fps rendering. The bird needs gravity, jump velocity, and rotation based on velocity for that satisfying feel.

content.details: Added AABB collision between bird hitbox and pipe rectangles. Game over triggers on collision or out-of-bounds.

content.description: Adding score counter and game over screen

content.text: The game is functional. Let me add some polish - bird rotation based on velocity for that satisfying feel when jumping/falling, and smooth CSS styling for the canvas container.

content.details: All game mechanics working: jump on click/space, pipe scrolling, collision, scoring, game over, restart.
